messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling books
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/00 11:08:44 AM !!!First Boot!!!, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:  It is one my shelf
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/00 11:08:44 AM !!!First Boot!!!,
Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< Has anyone else on this list read it? >>

It is one my shelf right now! I have read it but I found Grace Lewellyn's
Teenage Liberation Handbook to be much more empowering and freeing. Even if
your kiddies are younger now, it is a good read for Mom's who often freak out
about the unschooling thing. My guys are 11 and 12 and they are reading the
book this year themselves. How else are they going to get Mom off their
back? <BG> I think they will finally have a sense of control over their own
destinies after reading it.

Also, Grace's book is great for Mom's and Dad's who are having a tough time
unschooling/deschooling themselves. I was able to take a deep breathe and
relax after reading it. My kids are happier now too.

Kim
